uses seperate instances per test (mild dig at

ests as well?

tance is all

I think we're talking about different things.
=

The limitation you are talking about has nothing to do with JUnit or TestN=
G.
It's just harder to rerun a test method whose configuration has been
gen=
erated dynamically, whether it was done the JUnit way (added to the suite
p=
rogrammatically) or the TestNG way (invoked with parameters).

Or did I mis=
understand what you are saying?
